text.section:
Except as otherwise provided in § 6-102 of this article and except as otherwise provided under this section, government-owned property is not subject to property tax, if the property:
is devoted to a governmental use or purpose; and
is owned by:
the federal government;
the State;
a county or a municipal corporation; or
an agency or instrumentality of the federal government, the State, a county, or of a municipal corporation.
The exemption provided for the property owned by an agency or instrumentality in subsection (a)(2)(iv) of this section applies only to the extent that a law exempts the property.
